001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import java.net.URI;
009import java.net.URISyntaxException;
010import java.nio.file.InvalidPathException;
011import java.nio.file.Path;
012import java.nio.file.Paths;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014import java.util.Objects;
015import java.util.regex.Pattern;
016
017import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
018
019public final class UriUtils {
020  private static final Pattern URI_SEPERATOR_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\/");
021  private static final String URI_SEPERATOR = "/";
022
023  private UriUtils() {
024    // disable construction
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Process a string to a local file path or remote location. If the location is
029   * convertible to a URI, return the {@link URI}. Normalize the resulting URI
030   * with the base URI, if provided.
031   *
032   * @param location
033   *          a string defining a remote or local file-based location
034   * @param baseUri
035   *          the base URI to use for URI normalization
036   * @return a new URI
037   * @throws URISyntaxException
038   *           an error if the location string is not convertible to URI
039   */
040  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.PreserveStackTrace")
041  @NonNull
042  public static URI toUri(@NonNull String location, @NonNull URI baseUri) throws URISyntaxException {
043    URI asUri;
044    try {
045      asUri = new URI(location);
046    } catch (URISyntaxException ex) {
047      // the location is not a valid URI
048      try {
049        // try to parse the location as a local file path
050        Path path = Paths.get(location);
051        asUri = path.toUri();
052      } catch (InvalidPathException ex2) {
053        // not a local file path, so rethrow the original URI expection
054        throw ex;
055      }
056    }
057    return ObjectUtils.notNull(baseUri.resolve(asUri.normalize()));
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * This function extends the functionality of {@link URI#relativize(URI)} by
062   * supporting relative reference pathing (e.g., ..), when the {@code prepend}
063   * parameter is set to {@code true}.
064   *
065   * @param base
066   *          the URI to relativize against
067   * @param other
068   *          the URI to make relative
069   * @param prepend
070   *          if {@code true}, then prepend relative pathing
071   * @return a new relative URI
072   * @throws URISyntaxException
073   *           if any of the URIs are malformed
074   */
075  public static URI relativize(URI base, URI other, boolean prepend) throws URISyntaxException {
076    URI normBase = Objects.requireNonNull(base).normalize();
077    URI normOther = Objects.requireNonNull(other).normalize();
078    URI retval = normBase.relativize(normOther);
079
080    if (prepend && !normBase.isOpaque() && !retval.isOpaque() && hasSameSchemeAndAuthority(normBase, retval)) {
081      // the URIs are not opaque and they share the same scheme and authority
082      String basePath = normBase.getPath();
083      String targetPath = normOther.getPath();
084      String newPath = prependRelativePath(basePath, targetPath);
085
086      retval = new URI(null, null, newPath, normOther.getQuery(), normOther.getFragment());
087    }
088
089    return retval;
090  }
091
092  private static boolean hasSameSchemeAndAuthority(URI base, URI other) {
093    String baseScheme = base.getScheme();
094    boolean retval = (baseScheme == null && other.getScheme() == null)
095        || (baseScheme != null && baseScheme.equals(other.getScheme()));
096    String baseAuthority = base.getAuthority();
097    retval = retval && ((baseAuthority == null && other.getAuthority() == null)
098        || (baseAuthority != null && baseAuthority.equals(other.getAuthority())));
099    return retval;
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Get the path of the provided target relative to the path of the provided
104   * base.
105   *
106   * @param base
107   *          the base path to resolve against
108   * @param target
109   *          the URI to relativize against the base
110   * @return the relativized URI
111   */
112  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CyclomaticComplexity")
113  public static String prependRelativePath(String base, String target) {
114    // based on code from
115    // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10801283/get-relative-path-of-two-uris-in-java
116
117    // Split paths into segments
118    String[] baseSegments = URI_SEPERATOR_PATTERN.split(base);
119    String[] targetSegments = URI_SEPERATOR_PATTERN.split(target, -1);
120
121    // Discard trailing segment of base path, since this resource doesn't matter
122    if (baseSegments.length > 0 && !base.endsWith(URI_SEPERATOR)) {
123      baseSegments = Arrays.copyOf(baseSegments, baseSegments.length - 1);
124    }
125
126    // Remove common prefix segments
127    int segmentIndex = 0;
128    while (segmentIndex < baseSegments.length && segmentIndex < targetSegments.length
129        && baseSegments[segmentIndex].equals(targetSegments[segmentIndex])) {
130      segmentIndex++;
131    }
132
133    // Construct the relative path
134    StringBuilder retval = new StringBuilder();
135    for (int j = 0; j < (baseSegments.length - segmentIndex); j++) {
136      retval.append("..");
137      if (retval.length() != 0) {
138        retval.append(URI_SEPERATOR);
139      }
140    }
141
142    for (int j = segmentIndex; j < targetSegments.length; j++) {
143      retval.append(targetSegments[j]);
144      if (retval.length() != 0 && j < targetSegments.length - 1) {
145        retval.append(URI_SEPERATOR);
146      }
147    }
148    return retval.toString();
149  }
150}
